title: Peter Kay's Charitable Tour for Cancer Support
summary: Comedian Peter Kay has made a significant announcement that all profits from his upcoming 2026 stand-up tour, titled 'Better Late Than Never,' will be donated to 12 cancer charities. The tour starts in December and concludes in Manchester, with additional dates recently added. Kay emphasized that the initiative aims to support charities that assist individuals affected by various cancers, noting that many people know someone impacted by these diseases. He encouraged public support, highlighting that the cause transcends personal enjoyment of his comedy. Representatives from charities like Blood Cancer UK and The Brain Tumour Charity expressed deep gratitude, describing the donation as a milestone that will enhance their efforts in research and patient support. This move comes amid growing demand for cancer charity services over the past decade, underscoring the importance of such philanthropic acts in addressing health challenges.

Understanding the impact of such donations can highlight how public figures can drive positive change in health sectors.
